I understand. If you find that your home environment is too comfortable and that is making it hard for you to stay focused, there are several things you can do to make your workspace more stimulating, such as:

1. Change your scenery: If it's possible, try to work in a different room or area of your home to create a new environment. If you have a backyard or patio, consider working outside on occasion to get some fresh air and a change of scenery.

2. Add some greenery: Plants can help create a more vibrant work environment. Consider adding a few indoor plants to your workspace to make it more visually appealing.

3. Get creative with decor: Consider hanging up some artwork, prints, or photos that inspire you. You can also add some decorative touches to your workspace, such as colorful desk accessories or unique lighting.

4. Invest in comfortable office furniture: If your home office space is lacking in terms of comfort and ergonomics, invest in a comfortable desk chair and a desk that is the appropriate height for you. This will help you focus better and avoid unnecessary discomfort.

5. Set up a standing desk: If you find yourself feeling too sedentary while working, consider setting up a standing desk. This will keep you more alert and engaged in your work.

Remember to experiment with what works best for you. Try out different ideas to make your workspace more stimulating and try to find a balance between comfort and productivity.
